page.title: 19Local History.
page.content: Derivations of other place names. Pontshill-Ponchille -Domesday 1086 Knockalls-Knoka - Old Danish Wharton-Hwart-guard/lookout+wall- O.E. Cornage meaning Rookery re.Old French Howley was a common place in Danelaw Lyndors from Llyndwr water of the lake Bradley from abroad wood clearing. Delves from Latin hole or pit. Castle End refers to Eccleswall Castle the home of the Earls of Shrewsbury from the 13th.Century.(Talbot Family) Wigpool has two dis-used iron pits on the plateau whilst vertically underneath it has an entrance into the Gold Mine which arose in 1906 as a speculative adventure for gold but failed 6 months later with a loss of Â£49,000 as shares.Local people had shares and this subject is tabooed in local homes for it reflects dishonour.
